intro: Pharus glaber var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy pharus, is a variant of the pharus plant characterized by its pubescent or hairy stems and leaves. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its foliage is often finely divided, and it may produce small, yellow flowers in the summer months. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique texture and appearance.
